intro: Venegasia carpesioides, commonly known as the false boxwood, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are typically white or pale yellow, adding ornamental value. Venegasia carpesioides is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive appearance.
